Reviews.Content: Bad location, less than average hotel I stayed here the first time I ever went to Florence (I am catching up with my late reviews) and I was sorely disappointed with the surroundings. You expect Florence to be this postcard place and it is when you arrive at a place like this that you realize it is not all postcards. This is far from the center and not convenient at all, unless you are driving through Italy and you can't afford or don't want to pay the Florence congestion charge or pricey parking fees in the center. I would say the only positive aspect about this hotel is the parking. The hotel itself is outdated, depressing and expensive for what it is. Stay here only if you need to.
Reviews.Author: brazilianwanderlust

Reviews.Content: Good Business hotel Me and my partner stayed in the Florence in October we had a great time, the maid came to clean our room every morning and if you were still in bed she would come back while you were out at breakfast, there was always someone cleaning the hotel, the staff were friendly and the fact you could hire things and book day trips through reception was great, yes it's not 5* but it's clean, friendly and provides everything you need.
Reviews.Author: Frank73

Reviews.Content: Not recommended at all! Very disappointing for a four-star hotel. Extremely noisy, bad food and too far away from the city centre. We stayed for a couple of nights; the first one we couldn鈥檛 sleep at all as the air-conditioning system was on top of our bedroom on the roof and was tremendously noisy. The second night we were relocated to a 鈥渕ore quiet鈥?room which was facing the railways and you could hear a train every half hour. The only positive point of the hotel is the free parking.
Reviews.Author: Young_couple-UK

Reviews.Content: comfortable; affordable we stayed 5 days; a great value; breakfast quite satisfying; front desk young gentleman very helpful; we bussed into city center easily (used bus system all around Florence); was afraid to stay here after some of the reviews......turned out great.
Reviews.Author: tentative

Reviews.Content: Not fantastic, but satisfactory for the price Stayed here in August 2006 with my fiance while on a driving trip around Italy. We chose this hotel becasue at 59 euros for a double it was cheaper than staying in town and we had a car which would make it difficult to get closer into the centre of Florence anyway.10 minute bus ride to city.Staff service was pretty ordinary (borderline rude) but we care more about the room so it didn't bother us that much. First impression was ok. Big-ish Hotel with standard room and facilities. Bit dated but still serves its purpose. No major issue except room smelled of smoke.I would recommend staying here if you have a car and dont mind the bus ride to town, but I suspect there is better around town for the money.
Reviews.Author: andrelima

Reviews.Content: Travel no-no worst hotel of my european tour! after a tiring day of shopping in beautiful florence, we drove for what seemed like a while to the golden tulip. food in the hotel was horrible! plates and utencils not even set up correctly. the only thing i ate was the dessert, which wasnt even that great. the room was tiny, but that goes with many european hotels. bathroom was tiiiiny as well and dirty. it's so far from the florence center and the service wasnt good. avoid as much as possible. Would consider this a 2 star hotel, not a 3 as it's rated.
Reviews.Author: travellover_214

Reviews.Content: Beware Upon entering the lobby mid-afternoon, I was shocked and bothered by the lack of people around. . I never saw another guest even into the evening hours! This made me very uncomfortable and I couldn鈥檛 help but wonder what was it that I didn't know about this place that others did. The receptionist was totally bored/uninterested and did not help me with any details such as: would I like a wake-up call or did I need a taxi in the morning. When I asked for a non-smoking room, the response was that they do not exist in Florence. The WORST, however, was that upon my departure very early the next morning, I had to wake up the clerk working at the desk by yelling 4 or 5 times: is anybody here? This was most distressing to me as I was depending upon this staff to call a taxi for me. They would not call the night before as I had requested telling me that it was not possible to make a reservation in advance for a taxi. Finally, as a very fitting conclusion to this dismal experience, I was charged again at the desk with the statement that the room was not paid for. This was a shocker to me since I had booked it online and had already paid for it with my credit card. But, since I needed a taxi, I figured I better do what they say and pay for the room again. Once home, took care of the double billing. Come to find out, the clerk did not even know their own hotel booking codes.
Reviews.Author: buonarotti

Reviews.Content: Very disappointing We spent 2 nights at the Golden Tulip Mirage Hotel recently. It is advertised as a 4* hotel but does reach the standard we would have expected from a 4*. None of the reception staff was particularly helpful and, in one case, the female receptionist on duty on the evening of 3 August was rude and unwelcoming on our arrival to the hotel. We asked if we could book advanced tickets for the Uffizi through the reception desk for the following day and were met with a dismissive shrug and a statement to the effect that it would probably be too busy. In other words, she wasn't even going to try. As this is one of the services the hotel offers on its website, we were quite annoyed to find that the staff actually have no interest in providing the service when requested. Our rooms were not the best either. The beds were hard and the carpet looked like it had not been vacuumed for a few days. The ensuite bathroom, while large, did not have any soap. The mini bar was not stocked with all the items listed in the information booklet and we were concerned that we would be charged for the missing items. The hotel restaurant is poor value for money and there are very few alternatives around the area. Despite walking for several kilometers, we could not find a shop anywhere near the hotel. All in all, a very disappointing experience and we recommend that you spend your money on a nicer hotel in a better location. The only positive thing we have to say about the Mirage is that the barman is friendly and very efficient. They should put him in charge!
Reviews.Author: KerryAnne

Reviews.Content: Disappointing single room, great bar manager I stayed in this hotel for two nights as part of a coach tour. To be honest my only negative comments relate to the size of my room and the non-functioning air conditioning. It was room 514. The expression 'not enough room to swing a cat' springs to mind and trust me...in June, it's like an oven without aircon.I was the sole occupant of the room which may have accounted for it's size. In contrast my two friends who shared a room had a great room with a balcony.Single travellers beware.The room itself was clean and the shower worked - even if it was a tad basic. One of the major plus's was the bar! If you get a chance, go to the bar and meet the manager, do so. He is definitely welcoming, even if you don't buy a drink! And if you're into kareoke then you'll have some great fun!
Reviews.Author: triptriptrip

Reviews.Content: Block of flats converted into hotel! Very disappointed with this hotel. Stayed at Tulip hotels previously and this did not live up to expectations. It is out of town on a very busy highway in between blocks of flats. I heard the hotel manager advise people not to go out of a night because of crime (except via taxi). The rooms are very drab and we could see into the rooms of nearby flats. Okay for a business traveller but not for tourists. A taxi costs about 15 Euros into the centre of Florence. My advice is to pay a little extra and stay in the centre - better atmosphere and location. we cancelled the second night because we were so disappointed. Choose somewhere else.
Reviews.Author: pstanfield7

Reviews.Content: Lots of space We had a very spacious 6th floor room with a balcony and a super view of the mountains. The reception staff were very friendly. We had plenty of hot water and clean towells. The breakfast was a cold buffet with a choice of cereals, choice of fruit juice, bread, cheese, meats, cakes and pastries as well as tea or coffee, served by smiling helpfull staff.The hotel is a few km from the centre of Florence . There is a choice of three buses at a stop about 5 minutes away. Bus tickets are available from the reception.We booked this hotel after reading comments which were not too good, We found it to be a good honest hotel with hard working staff and we would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Excellent 4 Business day Very quiet and confortable.Excellent for business and convention.5 minutes from Florence airport and not too far from center of the city.
Reviews.Author: Frank73

Reviews.Content: Bad location Stayed 2 nights on Trafalgar tour. Hotel is too far from city center - once u get to the hotel there is NO PLACE and NOTHING to do which defeats the purpose of visiting Florence. Hotel was clean and room was large (we had a triple). Showers overflowed onto bathroom floor. Toilet difficult to flush as you had to hold button for a long time. We would not stay at this hotel again because of location.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Disappointed Room temperature too hot. We were part of coach tour and were not allowed ham and cheese like other guests for breakfast. Very petty. Bar manager very nice and interesting.
Reviews.Author: Gerard2006

Reviews.Content: Avoid, if possible We had to stay in this hotel for 2 nights. We were with a group on a tour and the tour had booked this ugly hotel. The location is far from the city centre. You have to take a bus and the journey lasts for about half an hour. But the district that the hotel is located is not a good one and you can meet the beggars around the Duomo travelling with you on the same bus on your trip back to the hotel!!! Be careful with your valuables! The hotel is dirty, rooms are very old and unattended and is located close to a railway so can wake up during the night with train noise... There were around 30 mosquitos int our room and we had to kill them before going to sleep.. The walls are full of dead mosquito remnants !! What an experience !! My advice is to avoid this hotel if possible....
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Dirty and in need of a complete overhaul This hotel is simply the worst hotel I have ever stayed in in all my life. The rating is 4*, but I cannot start to tell how dirty the place is. The reception hall carpet could not have been cleaned or hoovered for months (I'm not joking! it was filthy). We were first shown to a room that was simply uninhabitable. It was dirty, old cold and uncomfortable. I could not stay in this room. I was paying four star money for this, and was horrified and shocked. After some protestation and negociation (they insisted on a price increase!) I was shown a room. As I had nowhere else to stay that night, I had to accept this, but it too was awful.My son suffered foodpoisoning that night, and the doctor that eventually arrived appeared to be in league with this operation, and appeared to be used to attending the hotel, and was ready with excuses. The location of the hotel was nowhere near the centre of Florence, and I ventured out for breakfast....it is situated in a shady part of town and I returned after about 300 yards in fear. In short a horrible, painful experience. If it is the only place in Florence you can find on your search for accommodation in Florence, take my advice, and search a nearby town or city and stay there.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: PLEASE do not stay here!!! This is an honest to god review. This was definitely the WORST of all 5 hotels we stayed at on our trip to France and Italy. I dont know where to begin.Location: We trained into Florence from Venice and found a cab to the hotel (17 euros) to find that the hotel is nowhere near the central of Rome. Even if you fly in to Florence please do not stay here. We were on a budget and could not afford to cab it everywhere so we opted to take the bus. First off the staff was no help in informing which busses to take so we finally figured it out on our own. You must walk 7-10 minutes from the hotel to catch either the 29, 30 or 35 which takes you into the heart of Florence at the train station. From there we just walked around to different destinations as this is where you want to be. We tried to go out our first night at the hotel only to find there was almost NOTHING around the neighborhood. On your walk to the bus stop there will be two restuarants towards the left, we chose the pizzeria which was average at best.Staff: Useless. All of the hotels we stayed in during our trip informed us upon arrival whether there was a morning breakfast. This staff said nothing (the breakfast is decent and was included which we missed on the first morning there as we did not know there was one) they just gave a room key and pointed us to the direction.Rooms: Nice size but thats the ONLY good thing. This is where the trip gets nasty. Hot water shuts off sporadically. Honestly, we had hot showers 2 of the 4 nights we were there I counted. NO Air conditioning, it was defintiely needed because for some reason the hotel was blasting the heater the entire time and the lobby and hallways felt like i was walkiong through hell. So naturally the heat transfers into the room. When we called reception to tell the we cant get the A/C to work they simply said thats because it is not connected. Useless. So naturally, we open the window, we enjoyed the breeze until we noticed that the windows (we were on the first floor) opened to a parking lot which gave direct access to our room from the window if someone wanted to come in say if we fell asleep with them open. No screens no bars no nothing. We were so hot we took this chance only to worry at each voice or sound we heard outside. The mosquitos that flew in were the least of our problems. I recommend staying closer to the downtown area and shell out the bus fare and heartache that we have gone through. It is always convenient to be in walking distance of everything rather than walking 10 minutes from the bus stop at night in a neighborhood you are not familiar with. I will never come back here in my lifetime and would not want anyone else to experience what we went through. You do not want to spend your vacation like this.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: You can find a better place in Florence We recently stayed in the Tulip Inn Mirage Hotel in Florence. This hotel was voted one of the best hotels, but I disagree.The location is outside of the main area. The bus stop is not close to the hotel. The buses stop a little before midnight, so you plan of being in the main area after midnight, you will need to get a cab.When checking in, one of the hotel staff made us feel like she was doing us a favor by giving us a room. She did not provide us with any normal information when checking in, just told us where our room was. We spoke to another person at the front desk that was much more friendlier to get any information.Our room needed updating. A chair was broken, the drain the the shower did not work to well, the remote control for the television was broken, and the mattress needed to be replaced. Additionally, there is no safe in the room.I was not impressed with this hotel at all. For the price, it was not a 4 star rating. I can stay closer to the main area at a better hotel for the same price.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Convenient and clean Looking at this place as we pulled in made me wonder if we made a good decision...it's in an area near the airport which is not very fancy. However, when we entered the lobby, it looked fine. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Our room was clean and adequately furnished, as was our bathroom. Because of the unusually cold weather I tried to turn the heat on in our room, but was told that the entire hotel turns off automatically. (maybe starting May 1?) A staff person did bring me an extra blanket which was very nice and is something to be remembered for future bookings...the breakfast was good, with the usual Italian fare-cereals, tortes, fresh fruits and cold cuts. If we needed to stay close to the airport again, we would stay here.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: 绌烘腐銇繎銇勩儧銉嗐儷   showReview(21745051, 'full');
